Description:
DigCompLMSAdmin is a competency framework for Moodle administrators, designed by Moodle Academy based on the DigCompEdu framework for educators.

It consists of:
  • 4 general thematic areas (Infrastructure, Operation, Integration, Practice) covering:
  • 8 areas of competence (Implementation, Maintenance and suport, Site structure,  User management, Site appearance/UX, Monitoring, Plugins and Extensions, Professional Practice) incorporating:
    • 31 competences.

This framework by  Moodle Academy (Moodle Pty Ltd) is licensed under CC BY 4.0. Original framework available at https://moodle.academy.

Thematic area: Infrastructure

Area of competence: Implementation

Set up an LMS on a suitable hosting environment.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Implementation

Incorporate good practice in embedding security in the LMS.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Implementation

Enable agreed privacy procedures appropriate to the institution and location.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Implementation

Enable agreed site policies appropriate to the institution and location.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Implementation

• Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Maintenance and support

Use recommended performance measures for optimisation and scalability.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Maintenance and support

Implement an agreed policy of regular upgrades.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Maintenance and support

Incorporate regular backups and resets in line with institutional requirements.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Maintenance and support

Support learners and staff to use the LMS.

  • Thematic area: Infrastructure
  • Area of competence: Maintenance and support

• Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site structure

Enable and record the most suitable site settings for the institution. Consider the use of course templates and site admin presets.

  • Area of competence: Site structure

Organise the LMS learning pathways in line with the needs of the institution.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site structure

Select the appropriate standard repositories and portfolios for learning and teaching.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site structure

• Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: User management

• Thematic area: Operation

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: User management

Assign, adapt and create roles appropriately.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: User management

Make thoughtful use of permissions to extend or restrict capabilities.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: User management

• Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site appearance/Functionality/UX

• Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site appearance/Functionality/UX

Brand or personalise the LMS with standard or contributed options.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Site appearance/Functionality/UX

Ensure the LMS meets official accessibility standards.

  • Thematic area: Operation

Ensure access on mobile devices, via mobile browsers and the mobile app, and mobile-friendly courses.

  • Area of competence: Monitoring

Run, create and, where appropriate share, relevant site reports with appropriate stakeholders.

Understand and promote the use of course reports.

  • Thematic area: Operation
  • Area of competence: Monitoring

Critically evaluate and implement where appropriate learning analytics.

  • Area of competence: Monitoring

Critically evaluate and implement where appropriate event monitoring.

  • Area of competence: Monitoring

• Thematic area: Integration
  • Area of competence: Plugins and extensions

Implement and update plugins and other integrations in line with an institutional policy.

  • Thematic area: Integration
  • Area of competence: Plugins and extensions

Install agreed useful plugins from the Moodle Plugins database.

  • Thematic area: Integration

• Thematic area: Practice
  • Area of competence: Professional practice

Report bugs and raise queries in the Moodle community via the Tracker and Moodle.org and contribute to the Moodle docs .Contribute contribute within the organisation's local or regional communities.

Engage in post-upgrade reviews, discussions with other admins, personal journals/blogging.p>
